newsitem.title: USA: Missouri crops hit by Artic blast, damage unknown.
newsitem.headline: Missouri crops hit by Artic blast, damage unknown.

text.p: A blast of Arctic cold hit Missouri crop areas this past weekend, but it was too early to assess the damage to wheat or corn, said the state's Agricultural Statistics Service weekly crop report.
Temperatures during the week ended Sunday averaged 12 to 18 degrees Fahrenheit below normal, except in the Bootheel, where temperatures were slightly below normal.

The winter wheat was rated 13 percent excellent, 50 good, 28 fair, eight poor and one very poor. The most favorable ratings were in the north-central, northeastern, central, east-central and southwestern districts.
Corn was 13 percent planted versus 16 a year ago and the 11 percent five-year average.
Oats were 76 percent planted versus 71 a year ago the 64 average.
Topsoil moisture was rated 51 percent surplus, 48 adequate and one short. No districts were reporting any significant shortages.
Pastures and ranges were rated eight percent excellent, 54 good, 33 fair and five poor.
